msContents.summary: Certificate that Keras, son of Sambathion, has worked five days on the embankments.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto, the Verso is blank

condition.ab: Light brown papyrus. The left side is broken, so the first five letters are missing, otherwise the papyrus is complete.

handDesc.p: Written along the fibres, in two columns. The first hand is very cursve and 'verschleift', the first letter(s) of a word written clearly, while the remaining letters are written in a sawtooth manner. The second hand is easy to read. The other hands are also cursive but less so than the 1st hand.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Peteus, son of Peteus and Apollonarion
Peteus, son of Kollouthos(?) and father of Peteus
Keras, son of Sambathion and Tapynchis, grandson of Pnepheros
Sambathion, son of Pnepheros and father of Keras

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Col. I:;The tenth year of Imperator Caesar Domitianus Augustus Germanicus. Has worked in (2.hand) the Psennophris canal (1.hand) for five days on the dikes for the same tenth year (2nd hand) on behalf of Karanis: (3rd hand) Peteus, the younger son of Peteus, son of Kollouthos(?), his mother being Apollonarion. (4th hand) I, Dionysios, have signed. (5th hand) I, Hephaistion, have signed for Peteus. (6th hand) I, Sarapion, have signed.;Col. II:;The tenth year of Imperator Caesar Domitianus Augustus Germanicus. Has worked in (2nd hand) the Psennophris canal (1st hand) for the five days on the dikes of the same tenth year (2nd hand) on behalf of Karanis, (3rd hand) Keras, son of Sambathion, son of Pnepheros, his mother being Tapynchis. (4th hand) I, Hephaistion, have signed for Keras. (5th hand) I, Sarapion, have signed.

listBibl.bibl: Sijpesteijn PJ, Chr. d'Eg. 53, 135-136, 1978 -- SB XIV 11892 -- Sijpesteijn PJ, P.MIch. XV, 690 (l. 5,13,14,15,16);Sijpesteijn PJ, Chr.d'Ég. 58 (1983) p. 209 (l.6,14) Sijpesteijn PJ, P.MIch. XV, 690 (l. 5,13,14,15,16);Sijpesteijn PJ, Chr.d'Ég. 58 (1983) p. 209 (l.6,14)
